definition: lit. many monks and not much gruel (idiom)/fig. not enough to go around/demand exceeds supply
many/much/often/a lot of/numerous/more/in excess/how (to what extent)/multi-/Taiwan pr. [duo2] when it means "how"
few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom

sentences.english: With a population of 1.3 billion, China has far more people than jobs to be filled.
sentences.chinese: 人口13億的中國，在就業方面可謂僧多粥少。

sentences.english: When the demand outnumbers the supply in the job market, there will come another high tide of unemployment.
sentences.chinese: 在僧多粥少的環境下，勢必再出現另一波失業潮。

sentences.english: Like every bubble, this is a game of musical chairs.
sentences.chinese: 就像每次泡沫一樣，現在是僧多粥少。

sentences.english: There actually is more than enough to go around.
sentences.chinese: 其實是有超過僧多粥少。

definition: see 僧多粥少[seng1 duo1 zhou1 shao3]
many wolves and not enough meat/not enough to go around
very short of (food, clean water etc)/extreme shortage/deficit
delicious cakes/popular person/sth that is in high demand
quota/number of places/place (in an institution, a group etc)
The higher ups have policies while the lower downs have their own ways of getting around them. (idiom)
pinyin: shang4 you3 zheng4 ce4 , xia4 you3 dui4 ce4

definition: lit. you fight, I snatch (idiom); to compete fiercely offering no quarter/fierce rivalry/tug-of-war
